comments:
Using 3.0M9
I have not found the trigger yet, but as I work eventually paste stops working.
If I quit Eclipse and start up again, it works again. Sometimes it works if I do
some other typing or copy something else and paste it, but this time that didn't
seem to work. Instead, I got an exception in the log (see below.) Usually my
workaround works. It does happen pretty frequently: once or twice a day.
I'll keep trying to figure out how to trigger it, but if there's any insight on
your side it would be helpful: it's a mystery to me.

!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception

Got this again. Had been working for a while, not doing anything unusual so far
as I could tell.

Had been doing a bit of refactoring .. the last few steps that I remember were:
extract constant
select line
ctrl-x
click at bottom of file
ctrl-v
"SWT Error"

The resulting stack trace in the log was identical to the last, except that it
had today's date.

Hm. Just happened *again*. This time I tried a couple of times -- it seems that
once it gets in it's failure mode it stays there: I had just used a 'quick fix'
to add a field and was cutting and pasting to move it to where I wanted (it's
always at the top, instead of in the 'sort order' I specify. Humph.) Boom.
Exception. Same one as before. I didn't quit right away, undid the cut and the
line was fine. I redid the cut, the line disappeared (as always) and the
exception happened again  (still the same). Another repeat gave the same result.

Hm. Just got the failure mode again. It seems that *copy* (ctrl-C) does not
work. If I cut (ctrl-X) and then paste (ctrl-V), it works fine. I try to copy
again, and it doesn't work.
Behaviour was consistent until a restart of eclipse.

Might be a dup of 65975? I'm going to mark it as such since it looks like it.
Originally I thought it was paste that didn't work, but now it seems that it is
copy that's busted.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 65975 ***
